intro: Senecio hualtaranensis, commonly known as the Hualtara Senecio, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of Chile. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, often in rocky or alpine regions, where it thrives in cool, dry conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and grayish-green, adapted to reduce water loss in its arid habitat. Senecio hualtaranensis is known for its delicate yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months.
